name: Absinthe Quiz | Wines, Beers and Spirits | 10 Questions

questions.text: Absinthe, a 144-proof drink popular in the 19th century, is now making a comeback. It has an unusual color. What is it?
questions.explanation:
green.

	One of absinthe's many nicknames was 'The Green Fairy.'

questions.text: From what plant is absinthe made?
questions.explanation:
wormwood.

	A serious problem, this: present in wormwood is a powerful hallucinogenic drug, thujone.

questions.text: In 1905, a man named Jean Lanfray killed his wife and children while in an absinthe daze, leading what nation of his to ban the drink in 1908?
questions.explanation:
Switzerland.

	Just in case you thought such crimes were an artifact of the decadent modern age.

questions.text: Absinthe was a critical component of the relationship between Paul Verlaine and what other French poet?

Who said, 'Absinthe has a wonderful color, (answer to Question 1 omitted). A glass of absinthe is as poetical as anything in the world. What difference is there between a glass of absinthe and a sunset?' ?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Wilde.

	Wilde also said, 'You mustn't mind that a poet is a drunk, rather that drunks are not always poets.'

questions.text: Who painted 'The Absinthe Drinker,' 'The Poet Cornutti,' and 'The Glass of Absinthe,' all dealing with the downside of the drink?
questions.explanation:
Pablo Picasso.

	Though the other artists also painted absinthe, they tended to portray it in a more favorable light.

questions.text: What playwright, author of 'Ubu roi' and creator of the cult figure Pere Ubu, called absinthe 'holy water' and 'essence of life'?
questions.explanation:
Alfred Jarry.

	Pere Ubu is a character who murders his way to the throne of Poland; is defeated by the son of the former king and driven to France; and subsequently vows to murder his way to the throne of France.

questions.text: What international movement began as a quest against absinthe?
What painter's 1876 work 'L'Absinthe' caused a massive controversy when displayed in London?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Degas.

	The painting provoked a public outcry over the 'decadence' of the French absinthe-drinkers.

questions.text: Who wrote 'Wormwood: A Drama of Paris' in 1890?
questions.explanation:
Marie Corelli.

	This rather heavy-handed work criticized both absinthe and 'the morbidness of the modern French mind'.
